page.title: 06Hook Farm
page.content: Like most dairy farms Hook Farm has been hit by the{E.E.C. milk quotas,} the herd of 130 Friesians produce 670,000 litres per year instead of the 750,000 litres the farmer,{Mr.Woolford would prefer. In addition to the dairy cattle there are 100 heifers, 2 beef cows and a {Hereford polled bull}valued at current prices at Â£1000. In the winter the cattle live in 9 cow houses, each holding 42 cows, they are fed on hay and silage grown on the{200 acres}of cultivated grassland. The feeding is computer controlled with{Â£130,000 of {equipment}used including heat retrieving unit and automatic cluster removal making the farm one of the most up to date in the district. Waste water from the milking parlour is sprayed on to the fields to dilute it and prevent pollution of streams.
